channel.title: iPod nano
channel.description:
I'm quite pissed off atm, as I'm in a hurry and when I am I get pissed off easily. I want to put a few songs in .flac format on my iPod nano, and as it doesn't support that format I have to convert them. So, what's a good program to convert them?
I managed to convert 2 with xilisoft audio converter, but after a struggle. But then I ran into another problem: iTunes won't let me drag them onto my iPod. I imported all my music into iTunes, which is about 20 gig. I don't want to completely synchronize, I just want to add 2 fucking songs and I can't find out how to do it. So second question: How to add a few songs to my iPod without it taking ages to completely remove and re-add everything on it.
Thanks.

item.title: iPod nano
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I fixed my problem. I convert the .flac files with MediaMonkey gold. I don’t care about uber quality on my iPod.

Lock/whatever.

Read full topic

item.title: iPod nano
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

PROTIP IPOD VIDEOS POST GENERATION FIVE AND IPOD NANOS POST GENERATION ONE DO NOT SUPPORT CUSTOM FIRMWARE

!!!

Read full topic

item.title: iPod nano
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

R.I.P RSC:

and as it doesn’t support that format

http://www.rockbox.org/

Read full topic

item.title: iPod nano
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:2, topic:251053”]It doesn’t add and remove everything on it unless you’ve changed everything on it.

If I add two songs into the library and put them in the playlist to sync with the ipod, and then sync, it only updates those two songs.

I use dbPowerAmp or whatever. Google it.[/quote]

dbPowerAmp doesn’t support .flac as an input format.

I solved the problem of synchronizing. It was my impatience that was the problem.

Read full topic

item.title: iPod nano
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

use rockbox ipod os, it supports .flac

Read full topic

item.title: iPod nano
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

It doesn’t add and remove everything on it unless you’ve changed everything on it.

If I add two songs into the library and put them in the playlist to sync with the ipod, and then sync, it only updates those two songs.

I use dbPowerAmp or whatever. Google it.

Read full topic
